column1: Tim was in the kitchen, ready to make lunch. Tim wanted to make a big bowl of pasta. The pasta box was full. While Tim was busy cutting vegetables, his little sister came into the kitchen and took some pasta to play with. Tim sees his sister leaving the kitchen with some pasta in her hand.
column2: Does Tim think the pasta box is full or not?
column3: Tim believes the pasta box is not full.
column4: Tim believes the pasta box is full.

column1: Fiona was at the park with her friends. They wanted to play a game of soccer. The ball they had was clean and shiny. While they were playing, the ball rolled into a muddy puddle and got dirty. Fiona sees the ball in the muddy puddle.
column2: Does Fiona think the ball is clean or dirty?
column3: Fiona believes the ball is dirty.
column4: Fiona believes the ball is clean.

column3: Olivia believes the bread is dirty and smells bad.
column4: Olivia believes the bread is fresh and smells good.

column1: Jill was at the park, watching the kids play. She wanted to take a video of her son's first time on the swing. The camera was off. column3: Jill believes the camera is on.
column4: Jill believes the camera is off.
